Fetch ESIOS Time-Series as Data Frame

Source: R/esios2df.R
esios2df.Rd

esios2df retrieves raw time-series data for one or more ESIOS indicators over a specified date-time interval and returns a consolidated data.frame with one row per timestamp. Supported resolutions include:

  • "1min": 1 minute

  • "5min": 5 minutes

  • "10min": 10 minutes

  • "15min": 15 minutes

  • "30min": 30 minutes

  • "1hour": 1 hour

  • "4hour": 4 hours

  • "1day": 24 hours

Usage

esios2df(
  var_names,
  start_date,
  end_date,
  api_key,
  resolution = c("1min", "5min", "10min", "15min", "30min", "1hour", "4hour", "1day"),
  verbose = FALSE,
  encoding = "UTF-8"
)

Arguments

var_names

Character vector of indicators in "ShortName_ID" format.

start_date

Character string defining the interval start ("YYYY-MM-DD" or "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS").

end_date

Character string defining the interval end (same formats as start_date).

api_key

Your personal ESIOS API key.

resolution

Character: one of "1min","5min","10min","15min","30min","1hour","4hour","1day".

verbose

Logical; if TRUE, prints progress messages.

encoding

Character: JSON encoding (default "UTF-8").

Value

A data.frame with columns:

var_name

Indicator name as character

datetime

POSIXct timestamp in Europe/Madrid timezone

value

Numeric value

geocode

Integer geo-code or NA

geolabel

Character geo-label or NA
